title: Schema
description: Inline data type definition using a subset of JSON Schema Draft 7, used within API operations to describe request/response data shapes. For reusable canonical types, reference data-model layer entities instead. OpenAPI 3.0 restriction: a '$ref' within a Schema ignores all sibling keywords — unlike JSON Schema where $ref can be merged with other constraints.

properties.description: Map of property names to schema definitions for object types

items.description: Schema definition for array element types

required.description: List of required property names for object types

allOf.description: Composed schema: value must be valid against all listed schemas

oneOf.description: Composed schema: value must be valid against exactly one of the listed schemas

anyOf.description: Composed schema: value must be valid against one or more of the listed schemas

$ref.description: JSON Reference to another schema definition. In OpenAPI 3.0, sibling keywords are ignored when $ref is present.

readOnly.description: Indicates the property is read-only and should not be sent in request bodies.

writeOnly.description: Indicates the property is write-only and should not be included in response bodies.

deprecated.description: Marks the schema as deprecated. Consumers should migrate away from using it.

discriminator.description: Adds support for polymorphism by specifying the property name that determines the subtype (propertyName) and an optional mapping of values to schema references.

xml.description: XML serialization metadata for this schema when producing XML representations.

externalDocs.description: Reference to an api.externaldocumentation node providing additional documentation for this schema.
